intro: Schradera yutajensis, commonly known as the Yutajensis Schradera, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded understory environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
